Description: Semicircular artificial eye in stone with traces of black pigments to mark the iris and to outline the edge of the piece. The piece is flat and roughly carved. Black resinous deposit with textured dark brown stains covering on the back. The eye would have originally been placed on the orbit of a mummified individual.
Curator's comments: Published in: P.H.K. Gray, 'Artificial eyes in mummies', JEA 57 (1971), pl. XXXIV (bottom row, second from the left of fig. 1)
